translation.en: -[laughs] -[gasps]
Hey!
Hey, ice cream!
-Mine, mine, mine, mine, mine! -No!
[laughs] Empathy is over!
Being a bully is cool again!
Hey, I'm being bullied! Hey! [grunts]
-[Tuca] Whoop! -No! [groans]
Yes, it is I, Tuca!
Friend, hero, connoisseur of snacks!
Confident yet relatable.
Wearer of short shorts!
Stupid toucan!
That was my ice cream! [in deep voice] And you're gonna pay!
Life lesson, kiddo!
-Nothing belongs to anyone. -[bike bell rings]
translation.ko: 이 세상 모든 건 주인이 없어

translation.en: Hey, that's my bike!
-Tuca! -Bertie!
I miss you! Ugh, I hate change!
translation.ko: 보고 싶어! 난 변화가 정말 싫어

translation.en: The apartment is so quiet without you. And clean.
translation.ko: 네가 없으니까 집이 너무 조용하고 깨끗해

translation.en: I know! I'm so nasty.
I bring a lot of zest to my environment.
translation.ko: 그래도 내가 있어야 사람 사는 집 같지

translation.en: So, when do you wanna come over to get your things?
You're not officially moved out until you've taken out your last box of stuff.
translation.ko: 마지막 짐을 갖고 갈 때까지는 진짜 이사를 나간 게 아니야

translation.en: Sure, sure, I'll come get it later.
I'm just picking out some decor for my new place.
translation.ko: 지금은 새집을 꾸밀 것들을 고르고 있거든

translation.en: Tuca, are you getting junk off the street again?
translation.ko: 투카, 너 또 길에서 쓰레기를 주워 모으는 거야?

translation.en: No, I'm purchasing consumer goods... with my job money.
translation.ko: 아니야, 일해서 번 돈으로 제대로 된 상품을 사고 있어

translation.en: You don't have a job.
Just because I don't have a boring office job like you
doesn't mean I'm not swimming in gigs.
Mobile notary, fortune teller, unlicensed tour guide, dog walker,
translation.ko: 방문 공증인, 점쟁이 무허가 가이드, 개 산책 도우미

translation.en: cashing checks from my rich auntie, mobile notary again,
translation.ko: 부자 이모한테 수표 받는 사람 다시 방문 공증인

translation.en: and, uh, freelance junk collector.
Anyhoo, I'm swinging by our place...
I mean, your place, later today.
Wow, it'll be so weird to not be roommates anymore.
translation.ko: 이제 룸메이트가 아니라니 너무 이상할 것 같아

translation.en: Yeah. We've had such good times.
♪ Just you and me You and me forever ♪
♪ I want you to give me some more ♪
Oh, man, we've been through so much.
This is the end of an era, Tuca.
Yeah, it's no big deal. I'm sure we'll live together again at some point.
translation.ko: 유난 떨 거 없어 우린 다시 같이 살게 될 테니까

translation.en: Uh, I hope not.
I mean, I'm kinda hoping things work out with my boyfriend moving in. [chuckles] Ow!
translation.ko: 난 남자 친구와의 동거가 잘됐으면 좋겠거든

translation.en: ♪ Get 'em up, get 'em up Get 'em up now ♪
translation.ko: "스페클 건축가, 남자 친구" "연약한 정강이 실용적 바지 마니아"

translation.en: We'll see. Bye.
Is Tuca okay?
'Cause I can help move this box of hers over there if she needs--
translation.ko: 필요하면 내가 이 상자 옮기는 걸 도와줄 수...

translation.en: Nah, she's fine. I bet she's happy to have a space to herself
translation.ko: 투카는 괜찮아, 아무도 자기 스타일을 방해하지 않는

translation.en: with nobody cramping her style.
Well, now that the two of us live alone,
I can finally cut loose and walk around here with my butt out!
translation.ko: 드디어 나도 아무 걱정 없이 엉덩이를 까고 다닐 수 있겠네

translation.en: -Boom! Boom! Boom! -No!
Why does everyone I live with love free-buttin' it so much?
translation.ko: 왜 내 룸메이트들은 전부 엉덩이 까는 걸 좋아하는 거야?

translation.en: [chuckles] I knew Tuca and I had a common bond.
translation.ko: 역시 투카랑 내가 통하는 데가 있었네

translation.en: Hey, what do you think if I hang this picture up here?
translation.ko: 이 사진을 걸면 어떨 것 같아?

translation.en: Oh. It's, uh, a photo of your own face.
Yeah, makes me really happy. I think I look handsome in it.
translation.ko: 응, 이걸 보면 행복해지거든 잘생겨 보이는 것 같아

translation.en: That's what mirrors are for.
Come on, you get to have your things everywhere.
translation.ko: 왜 이래, 자기 물건은 사방에 뒀으면서

translation.en: Well, my things are cute and don't have my face on them.
translation.ko: 내 물건들은 귀엽잖아 내 얼굴이 들어 있지도 않고

translation.en: Uh-oh. What are we gonna do?
We're moving in together and you're already sick of my face.
translation.ko: 이제 함께 살 건데 벌써 내 얼굴이 지겨운가 보네

translation.en: [nervous chuckle] Yeah, if this doesn't work out, you'll have to move back out.
translation.ko: 그러게, 일이 잘 안 풀리면 자기가 다시 나가겠네

translation.en: Yep. And if we make any mistakes at all,
we'll probably break up and never see each other again.
translation.ko: 우린 헤어져서 다시는 볼 수 없을 거야

translation.en: And all our mutual friends will hate you,
translation.ko: 우릴 아는 친구들은 다 자기를 미워하고

translation.en: and no one else will ever love or understand you--
translation.ko: 다시는 그 누구도 자기를 사랑하거나 이해해 주지 않을...

translation.en: -[thumps] -[Speckle] Ow! Box!
translation.ko: 다시는 그 누구도 자기를 사랑하거나 이해해 주지 않을... 이놈의 상자!

translation.en: ♪ Got some random crap for my place ♪
translation.ko: 집에 둘 쓰레기를 마구 주워 왔지

translation.en: ♪ Putting freaky things in the space ♪
♪ Gotta get a lamp for this base ♪
♪ Accidentally break a vase with my face ♪
♪ Doesn't matter what I do 'Cause I live alone ♪
translation.ko: 멋대로 해도 상관없어 난 혼자 사니까

translation.en: Ugh. I'm so bored.
Nobody's here to listen to my great songs
and supply me with constant positive reinfo-fo!
translation.ko: 계속 흥을 돋워 줄 친구가 없잖아

translation.en: Hey, upstairs neighbor! Dapper Dog!
translation.ko: 이봐요, 위층 이웃! 말쑥한 개 씨!

translation.en: Wanna hear a totally improvised banger?
translation.ko: 즉석에서 지어 부르는 노래 듣고 싶어요?

translation.en: Mayhaps, if you first indulge me my tale of woe.
translation.ko: 어쩌면요, 당신이 내 슬픈 얘기를 먼저 들어 준다면 말이죠

translation.en: Oh, woe, my sweetest Henry!
Hard nope.
Hmm.
I know! I'll go visit Bertie.
Let's see, I'll put on my good walking shoes.
Better bring an umbrella. Maybe I'll listen to a podcast on the way.
translation.ko: 우산도 챙기는 게 좋겠다 가는 길에 팟캐스트도 들어야지

translation.en: All right, all ready.
[radio host] Welcome to Breakfast Talk. I'm your host, Billy Eggs.
Today's episode is brought to you by OvalSpace.
Make any idea beautiful online with over 30 identical templates.
translation.ko: 30개 이상의 똑같은 템플릿으로 아이디어를 멋지게 표현하세요

translation.en: OvalSpace.
Today's a great episode. We talked...
Oh, my God, you live so far away from me now.
translation.ko: 세상에, 이제 너랑 나랑 너무 멀리 사네

translation.en: [sighs] I'm so exhausted.
[chuckles] You're so lazy.
Ooh! Why don't you let me install a fireman's pole in the ceiling
translation.ko: 이 집 천장에 소방서 기둥을 설치하게 해 줄래?

translation.en: so I can slide down anytime?
translation.ko: 내가 언제든 타고 내려올 수 있게

translation.en: -I'm pretty sure the landlord wouldn't-- -Hey, Speckle's an architect.
I bet he'd love to get a big ol' pole in here!
translation.ko: 여기 큰 기둥을 세우면 좋아할 거야

translation.en: -Where's he at? -He's unpacking his toiletries.
[Speckle] Hmm...
Hmm, feather straightener.
Feather curler? Okay.
Yeah.
[screams] No!
-[objects clattering] -[Speckle] I'm okay!
-Mmm! Great muffins, neighbor. -[chuckles] Thanks, neighbor.
Oh, hey! Now we can do all kinds of neighbor stuff.
translation.ko: 맞다, 이제 이웃들이 하는 걸 우리도 할 수 있겠네

translation.en: Like, I can collect your mail
and water your cactus when you're out of town.
translation.ko: 너 없을 때 선인장에 물도 줄게

translation.en: Oh, no. My cactus passed away.
What happened? Did you overwater?
Pricktina, baby girl, just tell me what you need.
translation.ko: 프릭티나, 우리 아가 필요한 걸 말해 봐

translation.en: You thirsty?
Is this helping?
Child, you overwatered.
Can a mother overlove her daughter?
translation.ko: 엄마의 사랑이 딸을 망칠 수도 있는 걸까?

translation.en: -Yes, she can, and I'm the proof. -[laughs]
Anyways, what other neighbor stuff can we do?
translation.ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 이웃 활동이 또 뭐가 있지?

translation.en: Ooh! I can borrow a cup of sugar.
translation.ko: "반려동물 밥 주기 신문 훔치기" 설탕을 한 컵 빌려야겠다!

translation.en: Neighbors are constantly borrowing cups of sugar.
We aren't officially neighbors until I get that C-O-S.
translation.ko: 내가 '설컵'을 빌려야 우리가 진짜 이웃인 거야

translation.en: -♪ Cup-o'-sug' ♪ -[chuckles] Okay, okay!
♪ Bertie-ertie-ertie Getting sugar for her nae ♪
translation.ko: 버티가 이웃을 위해 설탕을 가지러 가네

translation.en: ♪ Sweet sugar being got By the hottie, Bertie-bae ♪
translation.ko: 섹시한 버티 아가씨가 달콤한 설탕을 가져오네

translation.en: I love when you make up theme songs for me.
translation.ko: 내 테마곡을 만들어 줄 때 진짜 기분 좋더라

translation.en: Huh. Speckle's sugar.
-Hmm. Here you go, Tuca. -Cute! Thanks.
translation.ko: 여기 있어, 투카 귀엽네, 고마워! 그럼 나중에 또 봐, 이웃사촌

translation.en: -Well, see you later, neighbor. -[chuckles]
translation.ko: 귀엽네, 고마워! 그럼 나중에 또 봐, 이웃사촌

translation.en: Wait, do you wanna grab your last box of stuff on your way out?
translation.ko: 잠깐만, 가는 길에 마지막 짐 상자도 가져갈래?

translation.en: I can't. Hands are full.
Okay, well, it's just kinda taking up some space here, so--
translation.ko: 알았어, 네 상자가 공간을 좀 차지해서...

translation.en: Sheesh! Relax about the box.
I will take care of it eventually.
Hmm...
Oh, that is really specific.
-[Speckle] Hey, Bertie? -Ah! Not my porn! I hate hunks!
translation.ko: 버티 내 거 아니야! 난 몸짱 싫어!

translation.en: Did you see my sugar bowl? I-- I put it here like an hour ago?
translation.ko: 내 설탕 그릇 봤어? 1시간 전쯤 여기 뒀는데

translation.en: Oh, actually, I lent it to Tuca.
-What? You gave her my gamby's sugar? -Gamby?
My Grandmother Robin. That was her sugar bowl.
translation.ko: 우리 할머니 말이야 그건 그분의 설탕 그릇이었어

translation.en: [Speckle] It's been in our family for generations.
translation.ko: 우리 집안 대대로 전해져 내려온 그릇이지

translation.en: [Bertie] Oh, no.
And when she passed away, we put her ashes in there.
translation.ko: 할머니께서 돌아가셨을 때 화장한 유골을 거기 넣었어

translation.en: Why, why, why?
Well, it's a Robin family tradition.
[Speckle] Gamby Robin was very sweet, so we mixed her with sugar.
translation.ko: 갬비 할머니는 달콤한 분이라서 유골을 설탕과 섞었지

translation.en: My gumbo was mixed with sage because he was wise.
My aunt was mixed with paprika, if you know what I mean.
translation.ko: 이모는 파프리카와 섞었어 무슨 뜻인지 알겠지?

translation.en: I don't know what any of this means.
It means that sugar bowl was important to me.
translation.ko: 그 설탕 그릇이 나한테 소중하다는 뜻이야

translation.en: Why would you give it to Tuca?
She asked!
I felt guilty for making her move out and I wanted her to be happy.
translation.ko: 투카를 내보낸 게 마음이 불편해서 기분 좋게 해 주고 싶었어

translation.en: [groans] So why didn't you give her your sugar?
Well, it was just really expensive.
You asked me to move in.
Now I can't hang up my pictures, there's no room for my stuff,
translation.ko: 내 사진도 못 걸게 하고 내 물건을 둘 곳도 없고

translation.en: and you gave my grandmother away.
I... I just need to feel like I live here, too, Bertie.
translation.ko: 나도 여기 산다는 느낌을 받고 싶어, 버티

translation.en: Oh, my God, you're right! I've been so thoughtless.
translation.ko: 맙소사, 자기 말이 맞아! 내가 너무 생각이 짧았어

translation.en: I'm gonna fix this, Speckle. Freeze right there.
translation.ko: 내가 바로잡을게, 스페클 거기 '얼음' 하고 있어

translation.en: [sighs] Well, I'm not one to pass up a good freeze.
Don't break up with me!
[Bertie] Tuca?
Hey, I need that sugar bowl back.
It was Speckle's and it's precious, and... Oh, God, Tuca. I really fudged things up.
translation.ko: 스페클 건데 소중한 거래 투카, 내가 일을 망쳐 버렸어

translation.en: He's gently disappointed in me!
Oh, no, that's the worst kind of disappointed
translation.ko: 이런, 그건 실망 중에 최악의 실망인데

translation.en: because you can't get defensive, so you really internalize the guilt.
translation.ko: 네가 원인을 제공했으니 뭐라 변명도 못 하잖아

translation.en: I know!
You know, this never would've happened if we'd just stayed roommates.
translation.ko: 우리가 룸메이트로 남았으면 이런 일도 없었을 거야

translation.en: -Tuca, the sugar bowl? Give it! -I gave it to a neighbor.
translation.ko: - 투카, 설탕 그릇이나 내놔! - 이웃한테 줬어

translation.en: -What? Why? -Because that's what neighbors do.
-[groans] -Plus, it tasted like ashes. Yuck!
translation.ko: - 뭐? 어째서? - 이웃이란 그런 거잖아 게다가 재 맛이 나더라고

translation.en: No! Who'd you give it to?
Oh, I just lent it to the plant lady who lives across from me.
translation.ko: 앞집에 사는 식물 여자한테 빌려준 것뿐이야

translation.en: Oh, my God, she is so cool. I can't believe you talked to her.
translation.ko: 세상에, 그 여자 진짜 멋지잖아 말을 섞어 봤단 말이야?

translation.en: Yeah, you know, I'm just trying to get into the fifth-floor vibe.
You fourth-floorers wouldn't get it.
Yo, Draca, it's me again, your fave new naby.
translation.ko: 드래카, 또 나예요 당신이 좋아하는 새 이웃요

translation.en: Hi. Uh, I'm Bertie. I've seen you around.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 전 버티예요 당신을 본 적 있어요

translation.en: Your style is so radical. Um--
-Hey, be cool. -I can't. I'm starved for her approval!
Hey!
Remember when I handed you some sugar and you rustled your leaves mysteriously?
translation.ko: 내가 설탕을 줘서 당신이 신비롭게 잎을 바스락거렸던 거 기억나요?

translation.en: That was a nice little moment we had, huh?
So, no big deal, but turns out we need that sug' back.
translation.ko: 별일은 아니고요, 그 설탕을 돌려받아야 할 것 같아요

translation.en: Do you still have it?
Ooh! We get to see her house!
-So... -Uh, cool place you got here, Draca.
-Really unique. -Tropical.
Okay, I'll say it. You have too many turtles.
translation.ko: 이 말은 해야겠어요 거북이가 너무 많네요

translation.en: [whispers] Hey, do you think the sugar is on one of these guys?
translation.ko: 이 녀석들 중 하나가 그 설탕을 갖고 있을까?

translation.en: Yeah, let's check these turts.
Mouthwash. Fertilizer.
Fashion magazine, dirty dishes. A tiny house?
translation.ko: - 패션 잡지, 더러운 접시 - 작은 집

translation.en: A love letter.
It's to another turtle!
[laughs] This is great.
This is hopeless, Tuca. I don't see the sugar anywhere.
translation.ko: 절망적이야, 투카 아무리 봐도 설탕이 안 보여

translation.en: Oh, yeah. The sugar. Right.
[gasps] Bertie, the window's open! Look!
translation.ko: 버티, 창문이 열려 있어 저기 봐!

translation.en: -Turt alert! -To the streets!
Um, thank you for having us over. Maybe we can hang out someti-- [yelps]
translation.ko: 오늘 초대해 주셔서 감사해요 우리 나중에 같이...

translation.en: Bye!
Speckle, I almost have the sugar back.
Just hold on a few more minutes. Don't dump me!
translation.ko: 조금만 더 기다려, 날 차지 마!

translation.en: [muffled] Okay.
This might be my best freeze yet.
-Hey, ladies. -Not now, Bruce.
translation.ko: - 안녕, 아가씨들 - 지금은 안 돼, 브루스

translation.en: Can't chat, Bruce. We're trying to chase down some sugar.
translation.ko: 얘기할 시간이 없어, 브루스 설탕을 추적하고 있거든

translation.en: -Why don't you give me some sugar? -Ugh. Bruce, give it up.
translation.ko: 나한테도 달콤한 걸 주지 그래? 브루스, 포기해

translation.en: I am never gonna sleep with you. Again.
translation.ko: 난 절대 당신이랑 안 자, 다시는!

translation.en: That was just a one-time thing I did twice.
translation.ko: 일회성 잠자리를 두 번 가진 것뿐이야

translation.en: -What? You slept with Bruce? -He's the main reason I'm sober now.
translation.ko: 뭐? 너 브루스랑 잤어? 그 덕에 술 끊었잖아

translation.en: When you relapse, I'll be waiting.
translation.ko: 다시 술독에 빠지게 되면 언제든 날 찾아 줘

translation.en: -Ugh. -Ooh, sick.
-Which way did it go? -Hmm.
-Oh, I got this. -Whoa.
Bertie, it's that dirty turtie!
-Hey there, little buddy. -[laughs]
Wait! That's our sugar!
Life lesson: nothing belongs to anyone!
translation.ko: 인생의 교훈으로 삼아 이 세상 모든 건 주인이 없어

translation.en: Damn it. That's a fun thing to say, but tough to hear.
translation.ko: 젠장, 말할 땐 좋았는데 들으려니 짜증 나네

translation.en: Come on, Tuca. Let's go!
-[hisses] -♪ Dirt-dirt-dirt-dirt-dirt-dirty turtie ♪
[distorted] ♪ Go! ♪
-♪ That dirt-dirt-dirt-dirty turtie ♪ -Hey!
♪ Dirt-dirt-dirt-dirty turtie ♪
♪ That dirt-dirt-dirt-dirty turtie ♪
Whoa. Pastry Pete's Patisserie.
Pastry Pete is so brilliant.
Did you know he won a Tasty Num Nums Award last year
translation.ko: 작년에 '맛있는 냠냠 상'을 수상한 거 알아?

translation.en: for combining crullers and Bundt cakes?
-They're called "crunts"! -Oh, you got a crush on him.
-Speckle better watch out. -I do not! Shut up!
I'm telling you, you gotta try those sweet, crusty crunts.
translation.ko: 너도 그 달콤하고 바삭한 꽈배기 케이크를 먹어 봐야 해

translation.en: -Ew! -Come on, let's go!
Give us back our sugar, you half-wet, half-dry, full-slime booger.
What's going on here?
[gasps] Pastry Pete!
♪ Woo! ♪
Why are you yelling at my nephew?
That's our sugar. That brat stole it from us.
translation.ko: 그건 우리 설탕인데 이 버릇없는 녀석이 훔쳐 갔어요

translation.en: My nephew is a perfect angel.
He says he found this on a public street turtle.
translation.ko: 길에 있는 거북이 등에 붙어 있었다던데요

translation.en: That's right, Unky Petey.
This child is a spoiled pile of soft-serve assface.
translation.ko: 이 꼬맹이는 버르장머리 없고 가증스러운 자식이라고요!

translation.en: Unky!
And stay out of my bakery.
Okay, but I might come back in to buy an éclair!
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 나중에 에클레어를 사러 올지도 몰라요

translation.en: Oh, Speckle is gonna hate me.
The first seed of resentment has been planted.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 원한의 씨앗이 싹을 틔웠다고

translation.en: This is my first time living with a boyfriend,
and I already totally fricked it up.
Hey, don't worry.
Worst-case scenario, you guys break up, and then I can move back in.
translation.ko: 최악의 경우 너희가 헤어지면 내가 다시 들어갈 수 있잖아!

translation.en: I don't want that! I want to live with my boyfriend.
translation.ko: 난 그러고 싶지 않아 내 남자 친구랑 살고 싶다고

translation.en: So, this is really permanent?
Well, I hope so.
-Why are you doing this to me? -This isn't about you!
translation.ko: 나한테 왜 이러는데? 네가 싫어서가 아니야

translation.en: Everything was great when we lived together.
translation.ko: 우리가 함께 살 땐 모든 게 좋았는데

translation.en: But now it's all, "Tuca, get your box of stuff out of the way!"
translation.ko: 이젠 이런 소리뿐이잖아 '투카, 나가는 길에 네 짐 가져가'

translation.en: "Tuca, get my sugar turt!"
"Tuca, erase yourself from the apartment we shared for six years
translation.ko: '투카, 우리가 6년간 함께 지낸 집에서 네 흔적을 지워'

translation.en: so I don't have to be reminded of you
while I'm living my perfect life with my boyfriend!"
translation.ko: '내 남자 친구랑 완벽한 삶을 살 수 있게!'

translation.en: I never said--
[Tuca] Now you're settling down, doing this normie life-plan bullshit,
translation.ko: 이제 넌 정착해서 평범하고 따분한 '인생 게임'을 할 거야

translation.en: and you're gonna get married, and have babies, and host dinner parties
translation.ko: 결혼도 하고 아기도 낳고 디너파티를 열어서

translation.en: where you serve things like crostini and bruschetta.
Well, you're not fooling me.
-Those are just toast! -What?
translation.ko: - 그래 봐야 다 그냥 토스트잖아! - 뭐?

translation.en: And you never wanna have fun adventures anymore.
translation.ko: 이제 넌 재미있는 모험은 바라지도 않잖아!

translation.en: You'd rather stay at home and be boring.
translation.ko: 집에 남아서 따분하게 구는 게 더 좋겠지

translation.en: I don't want to be boring.
I want to know that everything's going to be okay so I can relax! Ugh!
Right now, there's nothing I'd rather do than go home, putter around, watch TV,
translation.ko: 지금 내가 바라는 건 집에 가서 빈둥거리면서 TV를 보는 것뿐이야

translation.en: bake a big batch of croissants--
Huh. Croissants.
Uh-oh. You're getting that look you get whenever you have a dumb--
translation.ko: 크루아상? 이건 엉뚱한 생각을 할 때 짓는 표정인데...

translation.en: -I have an amazing idea! Follow me! -No!
[grunts] Hey, Pastry Puff!
Ugh.
Bertie here would like to challenge you to a croissant bake-off.
translation.ko: 여기 있는 버티가 당신에게 크루아상 대결을 신청하겠대요

translation.en: -Huh? -No, no, no! What are you doing?
He's a professional. I'm not good enough.
Bertie is the best chef in the whole world and she can kick your ass.
translation.ko: 버티는 세계 최고의 셰프라서 당신을 이길 수 있어요

translation.en: And we're having a really big fight right now, but she's my best friend!
translation.ko: 지금 크게 싸우는 중이긴 하지만 나랑 제일 친한 친구고요

translation.en: I don't really see how that's relevant.
If Bertie's croissants are better than yours,
you gotta give us back our sugar.
This is a bad idea, Tuca!
Well, by the chef's code, I cannot turn down a cooking challenge.
translation.ko: 셰프 규정상 요리 대결은 거절할 수 없어요 "셰프 규정 요리 대결 신청은 모두 수락할 것"

translation.en: So, we shall have a croissant tournament.
If you win, you'll get that sugar bowl.
translation.ko: 당신이 이기면 그 설탕 그릇을 돌려주죠

translation.en: And if I win, you need to babysit my nephew.
translation.ko: 내가 이기면 당신들은 내 조카를 돌봐 줘야 해요

translation.en: [laughs maniacally] Die, turtle!
-But my CPR license is expired! -We agree to your terms.
translation.ko: - 제 CPR 면허는 만료됐는걸요 - 조건을 받아들이죠

translation.en: -[growls] -Hmm...
This, uh... It just needs to chill for a bit.
Because that's a vital step in baking croissants, of course.
translation.ko: 크루아상을 구울 때 꼭 거쳐야 하는 단계니까요

translation.en: ♪ Bertie-ertie-ertie Gotta get that dough rolled ♪
♪ Crush it, little Bertie Win back that ash bowl ♪
translation.ko: 눌러 버려, 꼬마 버티 유골 그릇을 되찾자

translation.en: Ugh. Couldn't you have picked something simpler for this competition?
translation.ko: 대결 종목으로 더 단순한 걸 고를 순 없었어?

translation.en: You're the one who said croissants!
-[grunts] -Hey. So, um, I'm sorry about what I said.
I'm really excited for you and Speckle.
And you're not boring. You're a magnificent little weirdo.
translation.ko: 그리고 넌 따분하지 않아 정말 멋지고 귀여운 괴짜지

translation.en: Yeah?
translation.ko: 그래? 투카, 우리의 상황이 변하고 있긴 하지만

translation.en: You know, even though things are changing, Tuca, you're still my best friend.
translation.ko: 그래? 투카, 우리의 상황이 변하고 있긴 하지만 넌 여전히 내 베프야

translation.en: I need you.
Aw. And you always let me eat your snacks.
translation.ko: 게다가 넌 항상 나한테 네 간식을 주지!

translation.en: -[laughs] -What's wrong?
translation.ko: 게다가 넌 항상 나한테 네 간식을 주지! 왜 그래?

translation.en: Well, I'm still mad.
Even though we just made up, I still have an upset feeling.
translation.ko: 방금 화해하긴 했지만 아직 화난 마음이 남아 있어

translation.en: That's okay, buddy. Here, wanna punch some dough?
There you go! Better?
Yeah. Thanks.
Whoa, too much. Take it easy.
-[laughs] -Well, she's out of control.
translation.ko: 너무 과해, 적당히 해 통제 불능이네

translation.en: Somebody stop this woman. She's on a rampage! -[chuckles] -[timer dings]
translation.ko: 누가 이 여자 좀 말려 줘요 난동을 부리고 있어요

translation.en: Ooh! They're ready!
Mmm. Let's see. Very croissant-y.
Wait, why are you the one judging this competition?
Wow, this one is even croissantier.
Dare I say, croissantiest and best.
-[harmonica playing] -[applause]
This is absurd!
Hmm. Mm. Mm.
Mmm.
-What bakery do you work at? -Oh, I don't work at a bakery.
translation.ko: - 어느 제과점에서 일하죠? - 전 제과점에서 일하지 않아요

translation.en: -A restaurant, then? -No, I work at a magazine.
translation.ko: - 그럼 식당에서 일해요? - 아니요, 잡지사에 다녀요

translation.en: Ah, a gourmet food magazine! Which one?
Actually, it's just a magazine publisher.
I do mostly data processing.
Yeah, bitch, you got beat by a woman off the street!
translation.ko: 그래요, 얼간이 씨 아마추어한테 진 거라고요!

translation.en: Deal with it!
I see.
Here's my card.
Call me if you ever want to quit your desk job
and come work for me.
Your technique needs to be tamed, but I taste your passion.
-You're a, uh, croissant savant. -[gasps]
Make sure not to eat that card.
It's made of a very thin, toothsome wafer with sugar ink.
translation.ko: 아주 얇고 맛있는 웨이퍼에 설탕 잉크로 쓴 거거든요

translation.en: It took me ten years to learn how to make it.
translation.ko: 그걸 만드는 방법을 익히는 데 10년이나 걸렸어요

translation.en: -Dude, don't let me eat that card, m'kay? -Thank you?
And now, you can take back your sugar.
Surprise!
[muffled] My gamby is a cake now?
Whoops. Unfreeze!
Ooh, pins and needles! Don't touch me. Don't touch me right now.
translation.ko: 다리 저려! 지금 나 건드리면 안 돼

translation.en: Pins and needles! My gamby is a cake now?
translation.ko: 다리가 너무 저려! 우리 할머니가 케이크가 됐어?

translation.en: Baked by the Tasty Num Nums award-winning inventor of the crunt.
translation.ko: 꽈배기 케이크로 맛있는 냠냠 상을 수상한 셰프가 구운 거야

translation.en: -[chuckles] -We brought croissants, too.
Made out of regular ingredients, not dead people.
translation.ko: 이건 유골이 아니라 평범한 재료로 만든 거야

translation.en: Aw, jeez.
Oh, Speckle, is that you?
Gamby?
Oh, Speckle, my boy! My dearest grand-peep.
translation.ko: 스페클, 내 새끼! 내가 제일 사랑하는 손자 짹짹이!

translation.en: Oh, my God, I can't believe it's you!
I'm so glad I was baked into a cake
so I could say a proper goodbye and tell you I'm proud of you.
translation.ko: 네가 자랑스럽다는 얘기와 작별 인사를 할 수 있게 됐잖니

translation.en: Now, Speckle, please eat me.
Gobble me up, sweet child!
I'm trapped between the worlds of the living and the dead,
translation.ko: 난 산 자와 죽은 자의 세계 그 사이에 끼어 있단다

translation.en: and I need you to eat me so my soul can finally rest!
translation.ko: 네가 날 먹어 줘야 내가 편히 쉴 수 있어

translation.en: I... I can't!
Be a good boy and eat your gamby!
Yeah! Eat the ghost cake! Eat the ghost cake!
I guess I could try a little if-- if that's what you want, Gamby.
translation.ko: 할머니가 원하시는 게 그거라면 조금만 맛을 볼게요

translation.en: -Mm... -So? How do you like being an architect, baby boy?
It's rewarding work. I'm pretty good at it.
translation.ko: 보람찬 일이에요 제가 아주 잘하는 일이죠

translation.en: More bureaucracy than I anticipated, though.
You were always a bright one.
Oh, Gamby, you're actually really delicious.
This is the most disgusting and disturbing thing I've ever--
translation.ko: 내가 본 것 중에 가장 역겹고 충격적인 장면이야

translation.en: -Can I have some? -Tuca!
[Gamby] Speckle, sliding down your throat tickles!
translation.ko: 스페클, 네 목구멍을 타고 내려가려니 간지럽구나!

translation.en: [sighs] Settle down, Gamby.
[Gamby] Now, would you drink some gin and club soda
so I can have a party down here?
Gamby, be quiet!
Wow, so this all worked out pretty great, huh?
Oh, God, Speckle. I'm sorry I gave your sugar away.
translation.ko: 스페클, 자기 설탕을 함부로 남한테 줘서 미안해

translation.en: If you don't wanna live with me anymore, I understand.
translation.ko: 이제 나랑 살기 싫다고 해도 다 이해할게

translation.en: Don't want to live with you? Of course I want to live with you.
translation.ko: 자기랑 살기 싫다고? 당연히 같이 살고 싶지!

translation.en: Really?
Yeah! You know when you're coming home late at night?
translation.ko: - 정말? - 그럼! 가끔 밤늦게 집에 올 때가 있잖아

translation.en: [Bertie] Yeah?
[Speckle] And everything inside looks so warm and yellow,
and everything outside is so blue?
I love thinking about how, from now on,
translation.ko: 이런 생각을 하니까 너무 좋더라고 이제부터는

translation.en: this little piece of yellow is for us, our warm home together.
translation.ko: 그 따뜻한 노란색이 바로 우리 집이란 생각

translation.en: That's pretty gooey, huh?
Aw, you guys.
Okay, I'll bounce so you can get all mushy.
translation.ko: 좋아, 너희가 실컷 감상에 빠지게 얼른 사라져 줄게

translation.en: I guess I'll finally get my box of stuff out of your way.
translation.ko: 이제 내 짐 상자도 치워 줘야겠네

translation.en: -Then I'll be all done moving out. -Great idea!
translation.ko: - 그럼 이사가 끝나는 거지 - 좋은 생각이야!

translation.en: You know, Tuca, if you wanna leave your box here, you can.
-[gasps] Really? -Or you can just take it.
-Right now. -We've got room.
Then you can just come over whenever you need anything in it.
translation.ko: 그 물건 중 필요한 게 있을 때마다 그냥 가지러 오면 돼

translation.en: -Yeah? -Sure!
Aw. That would be great.
Let's see, it only has my toothbrush, my daily medication--
translation.ko: 어디 보자, 내 칫솔이랑 매일 먹는 약이랑...

translation.en: Oh, well, you don't have to leave every--
translation.ko: 그런 걸 다 남겨 둘 필요는...

translation.en: All my underwear, my sex toys.
Maybe just pick up the box and then, like, take it?
This will be great. My EpiPen, smoke detector batteries,
translation.ko: 잘됐다! 알레르기 약이랑 연기 감지기 배터리랑

translation.en: bike pump, old porn, new porn, frying pan, screwdriver...
translation.ko: 자전거 펌프, 옛날 포르노 새 포르노, 프라이팬, 드라이버...

translation.en: All right, gang, let's get this wingding bash-a-roo a-ragin'! -Agh! -Ooh! [giggles]
translation.ko: 좋아, 얘들아 끝내주는 파티를 벌여 보자꾸나!
